sub_title: Leader, (interim) manager and strategic management consultant
summary:
In a 33 Year UN Career, spanning 5 continents and 11 assignments, Richard developed a unique people centered and global outlook. At the strategic level his experience centers around management and accountability, as well as partnership and mediation. In SDG terms his experience has focused on climate and environment, inequity and poverty, as well as civic engagement and volunteerism. Richard has excellent facilitation skills and a proven track record as a strategic advisor.

In January 2021, Richard retired from active service with UN and started a focus on interim management roles. Since then he worked as President at amfori in Brussels and in October 2022 he took an another interim assignment as Regional Director Middle East for the UN’s Development Coordination Office. From 2017, Richard was the UN Resident Coordinator the Arab Republic of Egypt. He was requested to perform the functions of Deputy Special Representative of the Sectary General in Iraq, during an interim period in 2020.  As Executive Coordinator of UNV (2013-16), he stabilized the organization operationally and financially during the UN budgetary crisis. During this last phase of his career, while managing complex political, diplomatic and corporate processes,  he cocreated new SDG solutions  with the corporate sector, volunteer involving organizations and global civil society. 

He joined UNIDO in 1987 and he was subsequently assigned with UNDP to countries in Arab States, Africa, Asia and Pacific. As a UNDP Assistant Resident Representative and later Deputy Resident Representative, he worked on climate change, environment and natural resource management, disaster risk reduction, poverty reduction, private sector development, employment generation, youth development, child labour and other development topics.  Exceptional in a UN leadership trajectory, Mr. Dictus held specific management and administrative positions which broadened his organizational outlook beyond development substance. He has been UNDP's Deputy Director for Human Resources in NY, where he gained experience in organizational change management, accountability and the facilitation of organizational dynamics. 

He was UN Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative in Malawi from 2009 to 2012 and Fiji from 2005 to 2008. As UNRC/UNDP RR he engaged with the specific challenges of political complexity and fragility and he also served in complex countries like Pakistan, Sudan and Yemen. Richard has a strong social and professional engagement, as reflected in his no-executive roles.

school.name: Cornell, School for International Labour Studies

organizations.name: AUC John D. Gerhart Center for Philanthropy, Civic Engagement
Cairo International Center for Conflict Resolution, Peacekeeping and Peacebuilding (CCCPA)

profile_positions.description: As Regional Director my main focus was on providing management and substantive  support to 10 Resident Coordinators in the Middle East, ranging from UN mission settings, complex emergencies, humanitarian settings and  middle income countries to the group of net contributor countries in the Gulf. The diversity if this portfolio and the link between the UN's humanitarian and peace work, and Sustainable Development made this assignment challenging and worthwhile. The Regional Director is instrumental to ensure that the Secretary General reform of the UN's Development Systems reaches the next stage of maturity in the Middle East and this function required close collaboration with the Regional Directors of the UN Funds Programmes and Specialized Agencies.
profile_positions.title: Regional Director Middle East a.i.

profile_positions.description:
Seven months as President of amfori have flown by and I am pleased to have handed over to a new President. During my short tenure amfori picked up the path of transformation it initiated in 2018 – leadership in the BSCI and a creative force assisting members to respond to new Due Diligence Legislation that spans Human Rights, social performance, Gender, Global Labor Standards, environmental performance and increasingly climate impact. 2400 members with a combined business volume of $ 1,5 Trillion can thus shape the world by showing their capacity to respond to global challenges.

I ensured that the ICT Governance was activated and that timelines for important projects were maintained, products and services delivered and ensured more frequent and targeted communication to the members. Most importantly, I engaged with a highly diverse and talent team of predominantly young professionals – this is an organization with an incredible future if it can harness the creativity and motivation of this team, and link it strongly to the evolving business needs to the members. The sustainability challenges for global supply chains are very diverse and seem to be increasing over time, thus requiring a robust support that only an organization like amfori can provide.

amfori is the leading global business association for open and sustainable trade, It brings together over 2,400 retailers, importers, brands and associations from more than 40 countries.  For businesses today, doing good for people and planet is as important as revenue. Customers, stakeholders and NGOs are demanding that companies operate in a way which is ethical, transparent and sustainable.


. 



https://www.amfori.org/news/new-governance-amfori-richard-dick-dictus-appointed-interim-president
profile_positions.title: President
Retired UN Official, focusing on non-executive roles

profile_positions.description:
From the 1st of January 2019, I have taken up the position of UN Resident Coordinator. This is a continuation of the assignment I already held since January 2017, but without operational responsibilities for UNDP. The implication is that the role of the UN Resident Coordinator has been placed on a more impartial and empowered platform, working in equal fashion with all parts of the UN system. The position now reports directly to the UN Secretary General.

The full implications of the repositioning of the UN Resident Coordinator are not yet clear an there is a lot of work to be done with the Government of Egyp, UN agencies and Development Patterns in Egypt for the new role to take its final shape - I feel a bit like Michael Angelo in front of a new block of marble, trying to unlock the shape he already knows in contained there.
profile_positions.title: United Nations Resident Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the coordination of the UN's Humanitarian and Development activities, involving over 26 UN agencies. At the time, support to Iraq in its response to COVID was paramount, given the complexities of larger numbers of displaced people and continued hos in some provinces. Equally, the UN system was investing in new programmatic engagements that would provide durable solutions to the well over 1 Mln people still displaced after conflict. Finally, the role also involved frequent and close contact with the Authorities in Kurdistan and the coordination of operational responses in that region.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Special Representative /Humanitarian Coordinator/ Resident Coordinator for Iraq

profile_positions.description: Egypt is a country in transition - the Government led socio economic reform initiated in late 2016 is showing early sign of success. The Resident Coordinator's assignment is to position the United Nations County Team and the UN's programme activities towards national priorities and ensure  collectively we support the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The challenge is therefore two fold; first, we need to ensure that there is a unity of analysis and purpose amongst the 26 UN agencies active in Egypt. Since my arrival we have been building internal coalitions for action, developing joint programmes and ensuring we speak with one voice to key reform issues. The second part of the assignment focusses on the relationship with the Government. Adopting a SDG focus, the UN system needs to increasingly engage the development financing discussion. The knowledge and experience of the UN needs to be taken to a new level, where it will impact the lives of all poor, marginalized and deprived men and women. One major issue is Egypt's rapidly growing  population and the need to provide jobs, education and health services for a young and growing population. UNDP therefore continues to focus on poverty and the major disparities within society. It is looking to upscale successful programmes and bolster the national capacity to results and reform.
profile_positions.title: UN Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative

profile_positions.description: The Executive Coordinator provides leadership to an organiztation that manages 7500 volunteers at the forefront of peace and development globally. With offices in Bonn, Tokyo and New York, UNV manags a budget of about US$350 mln. per annum.
profile_positions.title: Executive Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Strategic direction and content of UN's engagement in Malawi.  This entails dynamic analysis of development trends and challenges,  management of UN reform efforts to increase efficiency and effectiveness, mobilization of resources form programme implementation and managing a political liaison with member-states and the Government of Malawi.

•	Successfully re-started the UN reform process in Malawi, with a new One Plan attracting an additional US$30 Mln for the One UN Fund. UN reform in Malawi has adopted a change management approach, seeking to structurally amend the way UN agencies are doing business through an UN Transformation Plan, outlining change management and transformation initiatives.
•	Revitalized the UN Security function, with a  new Security Risk Analysis, Security Plan, operationalization of a Emergency Response Team, as Malawi rapidly became to lead all countries in Southern Africa on the number of security incidents.
•	Development of the new UNDAF, seeking to focus more strongly on equity and pro-poor growth in agriculture, rural development, as well as the needs to the rural poor and most vulnerable segments of society.
•	Developed a highly innovative UN Climate Change Programme, mainstreaming DRR and DRM and successfully coordinated relief efforts for the earthquake swarm that hit the North of Malawi form December to February 2010, drought in 2010 and floods in 2011.
profile_positions.title: Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative

profile_positions.description:
•	Coordinated the formulation and agreement of the first Pacific UNDAF, spanning 14 Pacific Island Countries. 2 UNCTs and 14 UN Agencies. This UNDAF is the first regional approach and the first collaboration between UNCTs in different locations. It repositioned the UN system in the regional and country level dialogues and firmed up and expanded existing consultation structures, joint programmes and partnerships.
•	Operationalized the UNDP Pacific Centre to deliver US$ 6 Mln. per annum in high level technical assistance and support to regional organizations and Pacific Island Countries. The Pacific Centre is regarded as a best practice in UNDP, both in terms of the ground breaking nature of its substantive products, as well as its successful resource mobilization strategy, doubling UNDP resources in the first 2 years of operations.
•	Supported the Pacific Disaster Risk Management Programme,  supported NDMOs in Vanuatu, Fiji and Marshall islands and  the revitalization of the UNOCHA Pacific Office, re-engagement of ISRD in the Pacific and  coordinated the UNCTs response to security crisis in Solomon islands, Tonga and Fiji , as well as a Solomon Island Tsunami of April 2007.
profile_positions.title: Resident Coordinator and UNDP Resident Representative

profile_positions.description:
Strategic direction for compensation, renumeration and benefits management. Established an out-posted Payroll and Benefits Administration Unit in Copenhagen. Reorganized the UNDP HR section, benchmark against state of the art HR set-ups in corporate sector.

•	Coordinated a re-organization of OHR towards a state-of-the-art business and service-oriented structure, capable of effectively operating in an ERP-enabled environment. This entailed a detailed functional analysis, redesign of all jobs in OHR and the setting up and managing a job fair for about 70 assignments.
•	Managed the project for the establishment of a Benefit and Entitlements Management and a Global Payroll Unit in Copenhagen, including the mobilization and management of a US$ 6 million donation of the Danish Government, recruitment of 50 new staff, induction training and transfer of salient functions from NY to Copenhagen.
•	Direct responsible manager for HR Policy, Organizational Development, Information Technology, budget and operations management. The HR budget is the largest corporate budget in UNDP with a combined project delivery of about US$ 31 Million between various corporate initiatives and management projects.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director Human Resources
